category: vehicle incident general, vehicle Incident involving animal
text: wgpacs employee was heading to site location when a deer ran out in front of his vehicle, making contact with the front driver side fender and head light. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30354wgpacs employee was driving south on 74th ave nw on his way to the site location. it was roughly 6 a.m. and still dark outside. the deer came out of the ditch headingeastwards. when the employee saw the deer he slammed on his brakes but wasn't able to avoid hitting the deer. the deer made contact with the front driver side fender and head light. there were no injuries as a result of this incident. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee found within the operational plant area that did not have plant induction and did not have escape mask as required during an inspection of the work area a client employee identified one of the contractor employees in the work area who did not have plant  induction. the employee also did not have on his person an escape mask as required for personnel visiting the work area.the employee was a replacement welder who was taken to site by the construction manager of the appointed m&p contractor to show him the area where work was to be done whilst they were waiting for the operations induction session to start. employee was taken off site to go and complete the plant induction.incident was loaded onto cairs the following day and investigation process started.plant area visited section of the unit confirmed offline and cleaned out

employee felt irritation in both eyes employee was moving material at the sfc's in the bottom ash work area when he felt an irritation in both eyes. the employee told his supervisor and was brought to the safety department.  basic first aid administered in safety office

wgpacs employee was driving client vehicle on cr 240 when he noticed an oncoming vehicle loosing control and coming into his lane due to wet roads. wgpacs employee pulled off the road so he would not be hit but made contact with a traffic sign. migrated from legacy cairs incident #28901wgpascs employee was driving a cop vehicle on cr 240. employee noticed an oncomingvehicle loosing control and coming into his lanedue to wet roads. wgpacs employee reacted by pulling off the road into the shoulder lane. employee made contact with a traffic sign, causing damage to the passenger side mirror, back door and bed of truck. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

a wood employee tested positive for covid-19.  a wood employee received a positive covid-19 test result on 2/2/2021.  the wood employee was not experiencing symptoms and scheduled a covid 19 test which was a positive result.  contact tracing has been completed. employee has self quarantined and has notified management.  wood on site management has conducted contact tracing and notification to client.

category: weather related issue, foot or leg injury
text: mtc; waiward; laceration lower right leg; ks-2017-0053 two workers were in the process of securing material in v2 laydown.  a gust of wind pick up two pieces of skirting material (plywood) and contacted the ip as he was about to secure another piece.  the contact caused a laceration on the back of the ip's lower right leg. work was stopped and scene was frozen. ip was taken to onsite medic clinic where leg was assessed, ip was referred to regina hospital for further assessment. 12 sutures were required to close the wound. investigation initiated.

category: vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury
text: tool trailer was broken into over the weekend at libby-dcp project migrated from legacy cairs incident #38232tool trailer was broken into over the weekend at the libby dcp project in lea countyhobbs, nm area. this location is pretty isolated in the middle of no where. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

while manually moving plastic drum employee had finger caught between drum and fuel tank. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36343on 1/26/18 at approx. 8:00 am an employee was attempting to relocate 55 gallon plastic drum filled with def fluid closer to fuel tank for storage. while making his final adjustments the drum tipped toward the fuel tank the employee attempted to catch tipping drum resulting in the right index finger being caught between drum and fuel tank. he immediately notified supervisor and first aid measures were administered onsite. it was then determined that medical care was needed. hsse transported injured employee to nearest medical facility. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

rupture of paint can left under the driver’s seat in pickup migrated from legacy cairs incident #37834on the morning of april 20th after the morning safety meeting an employee went out to start his pickup and discovered that a paint can was left under the driver’s seat in pickup 120-1148 that was parked from the night before. the paint can must have rolled out from under the driver’s seat on the floorboard unnoticed next to the lebasted heater that is installed on the floorboard of the pickup underneath the back seat behind the driver and got heated up until it ruptured sometime during the night. there is paint splatter on the back floorboard, console and headliner in the pickup. there were no injuries or harm to the environment. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

person stood down from mobilisation for further medical assessment regarding fitness to work. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33607wgis rat attended petrofac training leg entry course on friday 31st march. during the draeger practical exercise, while descending the vertical ladder, mr sean mckenna fell backwards when he was on the last rung of the ladder. he stated afterwards he thought he blacked out. there is some conjecture in the e-mail trail below that “no evidence of this was witnessed by the 2 instructors who were present and when they came to his assistance”. mr mckenna actually re donned the equipment and completed the training at his request. height of last rung from ground 14.5 cms.the wg project was not aware of this until 10.49 today, monday 03rd april, when our hsse advisor susan richardson received a phone call from steven farquhar. this was followed up by an e-mail from steven farquhar that contained an e-mail chain going back to friday 31st that was sent from petrofac training to mike roulston. this e-mail contained a copy of the petrofac report of the incident, attached.as soon as we received the information myself, on behalf of wood group took the decision to standwgis ratdown pending further medical assessment to understand whyperson “blacked out”. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: vehicle incident general, lifting or moving loads
text: an employee driving a company truck was pulling out of a local business onto fm 523 when they were struck by another contractors vehicle. no injuries occurred and the employee was taken for a drug screen and an investigation began. migrated from legacy cairs incident #37781at approx. 11:20 on 4-11-18 a wood employee was pulling out of the buc-ees parking lot onto fm523 when they were broad sided by an oncoming axion delivery truck #60123. no injuries occurred and both vehicles had minor damage. the employees were taken for a drug screen and an investigation began. local authorities were involved. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

wood employee tested positive for covid-19  a worker who is working from home reported on november 9 that he was a contact with a positive  covid case and for this reason he decided to take a covid test, wich was positive. he is without symptoms and in self isolation. the worker reported to hsse and his supervisor.recommendations for her care were indicated

low speed vehicle collision between a car and motorcyclist in the sts compass point car park. no injuries sustained, minor damage to the car. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33916an employee (rebecca pateman) reported to the hssea team that she had been involved in an incident where she reversed (at low speed)into a motorcyclist in the cp car park this morning. she did not see the motorcyclist behind her and he subsequently fell of his motorbike, but was not injured. after an exchange of words the motorcyclist got back on his bike and drove into the undercroft but did not return to discuss the incident or report it to the hssea team. the driver of the motorcycle (alfonso gonzalaez)wasidentified and asked for his version of events, as follows:yes it was me, but it was only a small incident and i did not consider it worth reporting.as i came to the office this morning on my motorbike i approached the entrance to the underground car park behind a car. the car slowed down and then stopped, i stopped behind it thinking that perhaps they did not realise that they gates to the u/g car park were already opened and were looking for their electronic card.the car then started reversing and i did not have time to blow my horn before it hit the front wheel of my motorbike at slow speed at which time the car stopped.the impact made the bike lean to one side, i tried to keep it upright but could not quite hold it so i had to gently rest it on the floor while i stood on top of it.it turns out that the car had planned to park on the spaces immediately opposite the entrance to the underground car park and the driver said that they did not see me standing a couple of meters behind the car.i never fell off the bike and there was no damage to either vehicle..incident changed to report only as this was not work-related. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

while backfilling an open trench, the track hoe was straddling the ditch, dumping the dirt in the trench and packing with bucket.  operator did the first lift fine but on the second lift the trench gave way on one side and tipped the track hoe. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33868crew was back filling a ditch after installing a poly line. the trackhoe was straddling the ditch doing one foot lifts and compacting the dirt after finishing the first lift. the trackhoe operator started the second lift and was almost done when he notice the ditch had caved in a little behind him; as he started to move toward the other end of the ditch the boom side of the bank gave way causing the trackhoe to slide in the ditch and damage the covers for the engine on the boom side of the trackhoe. they used the bucket to pull the trackhoe out and calledsafety and there supervisor right away and did a stop work. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: security or general safety concern, foot or leg injury
text: report only – no injury or damage – casual employee engaged through hays recruitment escorted off site due to suspected safety breach. more information to follow. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38015report only – no injury or damage – casual employee engaged through hays recruitment escorted off site due to suspected safety breach. more information to follow.client and wood engaged hays personnel in managing of situation. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

operative injured his thumb whilst undertaking the pouring of concrete as part of foundation works an operative trapped his hand between scaffolding and the concrete skip. the ip has movement in his thumb but it appeared to be very swollen. the ip has been taken to hospital for further assessment/treatment.  ip taken to hospital for medical assessment/treatment. spen informed.
employee developed covid-19 symptoms employee developed covid-19 symptoms while at home self isolated and ordered a pcr test

lzt upper figures had been entered incorrectly as part of the shutdown mods t200 stripper deviation between t200 stripper lzt and lic alarm had been up in the ccr which was being investigated. when checking the lzt range and figures it was found range upper figures had been entered incorrectly as part of the shutdown modifications, which meant there was no high level trip protection on this level/ instrument.  meeting conducted to work a way forward between ops, inlec, otl and engineering.ora raised to allow the re-ranging and remedial work to be undertaken.2 x ops on the control panel to monitor the process while work ongoing.engineering and inlec confirmed figures were correctremedial work completed - all safe.

employee was tested with covid'19 positive  employee was tested with covid'19 positive and under home quarantine as per medical advice. employee was tested with covid'19 positive and under home quarantine as per medical advice. employee is currently residing at kerala.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, line of fire, slips & trips
text: employee was spreading the forks outward on a forklift and smashed his finger between the fork and mast. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36308the painting crew moved some pallets of material with the forklift and then had the task of moving some longer pipe so the forks of the forklift needed to be widened. the forklift operator got the forks into position were as the ip could get the forks repositioned. at this time the operator shut the forklift off and started to clean the windshield on the machine. the ip positioned himself between the forks to get them moved. the ip successfully got the first fork moved without incident and was moving the second fork when the incident occurred. while moving the second fork he placed his right hand towards the end of the fork for leverage to pick the fork up and placed his left hand on the fork that was resting on the mast of the forklift to push the fork to the outside of the mast. while doing this his right hand slipped off the fork causing it to drop back against the mast where his left hand was. the ip’s left hand was in the line of fire where the fork rests against the mast smashing his left middle finger. at this time the ip removed his impact glove and seen the injury and reported the incident to safety. the wound was cleaned and first aid measures were given then the ip was escorted to a medical care provider. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

worker hurt and injured his foot toe on his room doorstep . migrated from legacy cairs incident #3038812th may at 19:00 worker hurt and injured his foot toe on his room doorstep .   normal  0      21      false  false  false    fr  x-none  x-none                                       microsoftinternetexplorer4                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                13th may afternoon ip felt pain in his wound went to isgphysicien this later evacuated ip to in salah hospital for medical diagnostic .wgsomias were informed on this case by isg physician on 13th may .   normal  0      21      false  false  false    fr  x-none  x-none                                       microsoftinternetexplorer4                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                last information i have ip is coming back to sitewithout work stoppage. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general illness or health issue, weather related issue
text: report only – late, self reported potential heat induced stress for mechanical trades person. first aid treatment only required (hydrolyte). migrated from legacy cairs incident #34767report only – late report of potential (self reported)heat stress for mechanical trades person. precautionary first aid treatment with hydrolyte.this case is deemed a report only due to:tradesman did not report event on the day;tradesman attended personal gp after feeling unwell on waking the following day and did not consult client or wood on the illness;tradesman received a medical certificate which was not a queensland workers compensation certificate, the certificate stated "medical condition" and did not specify any particular condition;event reported two days later.trade self reported as 'potential heat stress'as a result of the above it cannot be determined with certainty that the illness was due to heat stress, and not an un-related and non-work relatedcoincidental condition.noting the above, and in line with normal policy as weather conditions become hotter, contract to roll out a programme of tool box talks emphasising hydration, breaks, shade etc. to work groups. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee was tested positive with covid-19. employee was tested positive with covid-19: employee had symptoms of covid-19. test results showed positive. employee was on self-isolation at home as per medical practitioner’s advice. after treatment employee got fully recovered on 05th may 2021. employee got fully recovered on 05th may 2021.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: employee was exiting building via exterior stairway, slipped and fell. migrated from legacy cairs incident #35864from cairs manual input formdescription: i was exiting the horseshoe building towards the back lot. as i was exiting it was raining fairly hard, so i either grabbed the handrail or started to grab the handrail with my right hand and missed (cannot remember), looked to see where i was going to step and proceeded to step down. as i put my weight on my foot stepping forward i felt my foot slip and i fell forward down the 3-4 stairs to the ground using my right hand to somewhat break my fall. i banged my legs up and landed on my stomach which was cause for concern as i am 7 months pregnant. i went to the er and after being monitored for several hours, everything was deemed ok and i went home. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

driver of 4x4 touched small post with electric gate sensor damaging the post and wiring chris lewis statement:team went to az136 and waited outside the access for livetrakway as instructed. whilst waiting the landowner approached the vehicle and asked if we wanted the gate opening. as vehicle was parked on the road the driver considered it safer to access site and park off the road to wait for livetrakway. the lady opened the gate and the driver drove through the gate turning a sharp left to park on a hard standing area, as he turned left he felt the wheel brush something. he got out and noticed that he had damaged a small post with a sensor on. the landowner approached and the driver apologised and told her he would contact his foreman, the lady then took a photograph of the sensor and then went back to her house. -	no one from afw or any sub-contractors is permitted to access az136 without contacting one of the afw project team first, we will then re-brief the team over the phone prior to access.-	deliver tbt informing afw/sub-contractors it is now mandatory to use a banksman when driving in and out of any access points along the routes no matter what size vehicle they are driving.-	assess all access routes and record any restricted/poor access routes in the sharps.

person placed coveralls in a laundry basket without fully checking pockets for loose items. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30174summarydue to the work carried out by witness, there is a requirement for him to use a small lock knife to cut pieces of rope. due to this, a number of months agowitness was issued a small bucklock knife which was logged on the platform knife register (as per bp procedure).witness has worked on the bp magnus for a number of years and is well versed on the laundry protocol around the checking of coveralls prior to placing same in the laundry basket for washing.during the morning of 07/04/2016, witness made his way to the platform laundry, checked his pockets for items, placed a 'checked card' in a top pocket and deposited them into a laundry bin for wash. at that point he was satisfied that the check he carried out meant there were no items within his pockets.about 0900 hours, same day, one of the laundry teamwentthrough the coveralls binto check coveralls for items prior to placing same in the wash. on doing this and retrieving the coveralls of witness, he found a small buck lock knife in a locked/closed position.as per laundry protocol, identifying an item that may cause damage to the washing machine, the laundry team member raised the matter to the platform hse lead.witness was advised of the item found and later provided a statement (as attached).investigation was instigated by the hsel. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

wood employee tested positive for covid-19 a wood employee has been working from home since june 25, 2020 and started to experience signs and symptoms of covid-19 on july 12, 2020. the employee stated that they had been exposed to a relative recently, that at the time, was not aware they were positive with covid. the ee went to seek medical evaluation on july 14, 2020 and received confirmation of positive covid test results the same day.  the ee reported this information to his immediate supervisor as well the client representative (celanese). medical post care/recommendation have been provided and the individual is to remain home, quarantined for the next 14 days.  hssea department will follow up with individual to confirm the status of their health and that the ee is recovering from the illness.

used n2 quad interconnecting pipe released nitrogen.  nitrogen gas leaked from the used n2 quad rack after it came into contact during lifting to the lorry at the tp3 laydown area (open to sky). no other asset was affected and no personnel  was hurt after the incident. investigation is ongoing.  job was stopped and let the remaining n2 gas was allowed to be released until pressure tank was emptied.

ip power hosed his left boot. the pressure punctured a hole and grazed his foot ip was operating a power washer on the slug catcher area at shell st fergus. he was standing on a small plastic hop up and as he stepped off he pulled the trigger on the lance which caught his left foot. he removed his rubber boot to examine his foot. a first aider also looked at his foot which had a small cut or graze. he was sent to peterhead casualty to be checked out but no treatment was required or given the work was stopped.

category: fall from or working at height issue, back injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was climbing a stationary ladder when he fell and landed on his back.
caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee was webbing up a press when his finger was caught in the press, amputating his fingertip.

struck by discharged object or substance while an employee was pressure testing a pipe, the test ball shot out of the pipe and severely lacerated the employee's left thumb. the employee was hospitalized.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was inspecting the brake drum and the left wheel on a forklift. while the employee was reinstalling the brake, his left little finger was caught between the drum and the brake drum. the finger was lacerated and the tip was amputated.
exposure through medical injection  an employee was getting a flu shot when the employee experienced nausea, dizziness, chest pressure, palpitations, and shortness of breath.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury, back injury, site compliance or practice issue
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was climbing a rail car ladder when he fell about 10 feet, hitting the ground and an adjacent rail car. he suffered a broken jaw and fractured vertebrae.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury, back injury, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level 11 to 15 feet  an employee was fixing a crossup at the sorter incline chain. the employee was attempting to get on the grating under the incline chain when his foot slipped and he fell in-between the guardrail and the grating. he fell 14 feet to the floor, hitting an airline on the way down. the employee was hospitalized with a fractured skull and possible fractured vertebrae.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was going to hammer in the shaft of a paddle wheel and was waiting for it to rotate to the correct position before shutting it off. his hand was on the guard when it slipped off the guard and became caught between the pulley and the belt. he suffered an amputation of the left ring finger just below the fingernail.

category: bites (animals or insects), hand or arm injury
text: other animal bites, nonvenomous an employee was delivering mail to a resident's home when a dog attacked him, causing an amputation injury to his left index finger.

contact with objects and equipment, unspecified on september 23, 2019, a blow mold assembler suffered a crushing injury to her left middle finger in the nail area, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was operating a lift to retrieve merchandise from an elevated rack. the employee's left hand struck the rack and his pinky finger was partially amputated. the employee was hospitalized for surgery.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a ladder.

category: hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury
text: injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker a carpenter was cutting 5-inch shims for a door jam project. while cutting on two saw horses, his saw kicked back and cut his left hand which was holding the wood board. he was hospitalized for a cut to his first and fifth digits and a severed tendon on the first digit that requires surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was cleaning two application rollers and caught his left index finger between the rollers resulting in a partial amputation. the equipment was not guarded or locked out at the time.

category: fall from or working at height issue, general injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a ladder to the ground, suffering a broken collarbone.

category: vehicle incident general, head or face injury, general injury, lifting or moving loads
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was loading inventories when a van flipped and hit the employee, throwing the employee into a concrete wall. the employee sustained a ruptured spleen, fractured skull, laceration to the brain, brain swelling, broken ribs, and collapsed lungs.

struck by rolling object or equipment-other than powered vehicle, unspecified an employee was placing tire tread onto trays on a tread cart. when employee stepped down between the cart and the guardrail to straighten the tread, the tugger moved and pinned the employee's left leg between the guardrail and the cart and fractured it.

category: vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury, dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads, slips & trips
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was repositioning an elevated steel beam on a lifting device that was about 6 inches off the ground. the employee was hitting the steel beam with a hammer when the beam slipped off the lifting device and crushed the toes on the employee's right foot.

category: dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was working between two stacks of concrete posts spaced approximately 2 feet apart from one another. each stack of posts had a total of two 12-foot long concrete posts, with the first stacked on a 4"x4" piece of dunnage. there was another post stacked on top of that with a 5" high piece of dunnage separating the two posts. as the employee was patching the posts, the 4"x4" dunnage on the bottom of the stack gave way and caused the stack to fall forward. the employee was pinned between the front stack of posts and the stack that fell forward. the employee's mid-section (front and back) was pinned for a few minutes until a forklift operator could push the stack off the employee. the employee was hospitalized for contusions to the upper body.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee suffered an amputation to his right hand (middle finger) while using a band saw to cut meat.

exposure to harmful substances or environments, unspecified on september 15, 2018, an employee removed a pipeline cap on a cip line and was burned by hot water and chemicals. the employee suffered burns to the face, back, arms, and legs.

category: back injury, slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on same level while climbing stairs, steps, or curbs on february 17, 2020, an employee slipped and fell while walking up stairs. he suffered bruising to the ankle and back and was hospitalized.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet on or about february 21, 2016, an employee fell approximately 2 feet from a feed trough and sustained head and back injuries.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was removing pizza from a conveyor line when their gloved finger became caught between the conveyor belt and a belt roller resulting in a fractured finger, a fingertip amputation, and a nail avulsion.

category: back injury, foot or leg injury
text: slip without fall, unspecified an employee missed a step while exiting his truck, injuring his leg and pelvis.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was rebuilding a puller machine and had it locked out. the employee then re-energized and started the machine. sometime after the machine was operational, the employee dropped a wrench on the floor next to the machine and attempted to pick it up with his right hand. his left hand was then pulled into the machine's belt and pulley system. the belt and pulley system was unguarded at the time.
stabbing, cutting, slashing, piercing one employee stabbed another with a pocket knife, causing abdominal wounds that required hospitalization and surgery.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was repairing a hoist from a rolling ladder. the employee fell off the ladder and landed about 8 feet below. the employee was hospitalized.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was changing the battery on a forklift. the battery shifted and smashed the employee's left middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.

category: lifting or moving loads, general injury, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was moving empty pallets in his trailer. when he stepped onto the liftgate on the back of the trailer, he slipped and fell to the ground. he fractured his collarbone and two ribs and punctured a lung, requiring hospitalization.

struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was clearing the conveyor belt that fed an auto shredder. a piece of rebar stuck in the conveyor struck the employee's lower left leg, breaking it.

category: burns, fire, foot or leg injury
text: ignition of vapors, gases, or liquids on or about 5/11/2016, an employee was delivering mail when he noticed smoke coming from a resident's garage. he stopped and noticed a gas can on fire and two kids in the garage. he told the kids to get out of the garage and to kick the gas can out. one of the kids kicked the gas can out of the garage. the can hit the employee and splattered gas on him. the gas caught on fire and caused third degree burns to both of his legs.
caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was operating a chop saw when it amputated his middle fingertip.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was attaching a steel cable for rigging a steel beam when the steel cable slid, pinching and amputating the thumb at the first joint.

struck by swinging part of powered vehicle an employee's hand was slammed in a bulldozer door as he left the vehicle. the employee's right ring and little fingers were injured; at the hospital, the tip of the little finger was amputated below the first joint.

category: hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee fell about 5 feet off an 8-foot step ladder to the ground while putting up fiberglass panels, fracturing an ankle and wrist.
struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was securing the back of a compactor with a bungee cord when the bungee cord struck and injured the employee's left eye.
caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified on or about january 29, 2015, an employee had his hand pulled into a saw.

category: head or face injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was operating a header machine when his foot slipped from the brake and his right hand thumb was caught in the machine, amputating the tip of his thumb.

fall on same level due to tripping on uneven surface a home healthcare/personal care attendant was taking out the trash and tripped and fell due to an uneven driveway resulting in fractures that required hospitalization.
fall on same level, unspecified a guide was back-country skiing with a client and fell, sustaining serious injuries.
fall on same level, unspecified an employee was throwing a bag of trash into the dumpster when he tripped/slipped and fell to the ground, injuring his hip. he was hospitalized and had surgery.
exposure to environmental heat an employee suffered heat-related cramping on returning to the ground after cutting/trimming trees.
fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee was walking into the facility entrance and fell to the floor. the employee was hospitalized with a fractured left hip.
compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was manually pushing a conveyor belt when her finger was caught underneath the belt, suffering a deep cut.

other jump to lower level less than 6 feet an employee had been filling water tanks on top of a flatbed trailer. the employee jumped three feet to the ground from a ladder on the truck. when he landed, his right ankle twisted and he fell, resulting in fractures to his right leg and ankle.
caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was operating a machine when his finger was amputated.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was hooking up a trailer to a truck. his left index finger was on the trailer tongue when the tongue dropped over the truck ball, catching and partially amputating his finger between the trailer and the truck.

contact with objects and equipment, n.e.c. an employee was jumping a short distance to push a box farther onto a shelf when the employee's ring became caught on the shelf and lacerated the employee's finger, resulting in a surgical amputation.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was changing hose reels at the cover extruder machine when his right thumb was caught in the kevlar string used to splice two sections of rubber hose, amputating it above the first knuckle. he required surgery.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: struck by discharged object or substance the employee was bracing a pallet with his foot so he could nail it with a nail gun. the employee slipped and the nail gun shot a nail into his foot.

category: fall from or working at height issue, weather related issue
text: exposure to environmental heat an employee was in training requalifying for ladders. the employee was climbing an extension ladder, got dizzy due to heat stress, and fell about 15 feet.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury, slips & trips

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee carrying large boxes tripped over a pallet and suffered a dislocated ankle and broken right foot.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was manipulating a piece of concrete with a burke bar when the employee's left middle finger was caught and amputated between the bar and a piece of pre-cast concrete.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on water vehicle an employee tripped on a lashing platform and fractured his right leg.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was working on a malfunctioning stem valve on the line. the employee's finger was inside the valve when 8 pounds of pressure came on and the valve closed on the employee's right third finger, removing the tip of the nail and some skin.
inhalation of harmful substance-single episode an employee was poisoned by carbon monoxide from a dishwasher.

category: vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury
text: collision between a moving and standing vehicle, nonroadway while driving an electric jack, an employee went around a corner and struck a second, parked jack. his foot went off his jack and was crushed between the two jacks.

machinery or equipment incident on water vehicle an employee was working from a barge, stabilizing a pier. while the employee was removing dunnage, the employee's left middle and ring fingers were caught between an h-beam and a steel plate. the ring fingertip was surgically amputated.

category: vehicle incident general, lifting or moving loads, foot or leg injury
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was struck by a moving cargo tug, fracturing her right ankle and lacerating her left leg.

struck by rolling object or equipment being pushed by injured worker an employee was pulling a steel trolley. the employee's left thumb was caught between the trolley and a door frame, causing a loss of tissue and the nail.

category: head or face injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee was on a ramp pulling on a cargo strap when the strap broke and the employee fell backward striking his head on the ground and causing a loss of consciousness.

part of occupantís body caught between vehicle and other object in nonroadway transport incident at about 7:30 p.m. on november 26, 2018, an employee was moving a pallet into a freezer using an electric pallet jack. as the jack turned, his right ankle was pinched and broken between the load and a wall. he was hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation on april 29, 2021, at 8:47 a.m., an employee was operating a winding machine when their right-hand middle, ring, and pinky fingers were crushed at the point of operation, resulting in hospitalization and fingertip amputations.
caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee amputated two fingers while a cleaning a mixer.

indirect exposure to electricity, greater than 220 volts two employees received electrical burns when an anchor cable was touched by a live electrical cable near the trench where the employees were working.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on same level, unspecified an employee lost his footing and fell in the path of an excavator bucket, which scraped his right leg, causing a hairline fracture and swelling that required hospitalization.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee was walking down a hallway when a scrubber machine struck her, causing her to fall over a pallet and break both ankles.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was lining up a garment on the track of the garment cutter when the cutting wheel activated and amputated her right thumb tip.

category: vehicle incident general, hand or arm injury, dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads, head or face injury
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was changing the head on a caser machine. an unsecured piece of equipment fell on the employee's hand, causing the amputation (without bone loss) of the right index fingertip.
